messages.text: I have a fever

✅ **Got it!** I've noted that you have **fever**.

🤔 **Quick check:** Are you also experiencing any of these related symptoms?
• headache • sore throat • diarrhea

💬 You can say **'yes to [symptom]'**, **'no'**, or **'that's all'** if you've covered everything.
i have headache, diarrhea

✅ **Understood!** So far you have: **fever, headache, diarrhea**.

🤔 **Quick check:** Are you also experiencing any of these related symptoms?
• liver damage • oligomenorrhea, loss of libido • abdominal cramps

💬 You can say **'yes to [symptom]'**, **'no'**, or **'that's all'** if you've covered everything.
loss of libido

👂 **I'm listening!**

Any other symptoms to add? Or say **'that's all'** when you're ready for my analysis.
that's all

🧠 **Analyzing your symptoms...**

I'm processing: fever, headache, diarrhea

Please wait a moment while I provide you with a comprehensive analysis...

🤔 **Preliminary Analysis** (Multiple Possibilities)
Your symptoms suggest **malaria** as a possibility, but other conditions should also be considered.

� **Understanding malaria:**
An infectious disease caused by protozoan parasites from the Plasmodium family that can be transmitted by the bite of the Anopheles mosquito or by a contaminated needle or transfusion. Falciparum malaria is the most deadly type.

🛡️ **Immediate Care Recommendations:**
• Consult nearest hospital
• avoid oily food
• avoid non veg food
• keep mosquitos out

📋 **Your Next Steps:**
• **Urgency Level:** Low - Monitor and consult if symptoms persist
• **Specialist to see:** General Medicine
• **What to tell your doctor:** Mention your symptoms: fever, headache, diarrhea
• **Preparation:** Note symptom duration, severity (1-10 scale), and any triggers

⚠️ **Important Medical Notice:**
I'm an AI assistant designed to help you understand your symptoms better, but I'm not a replacement for professional medical care. Think of me as a knowledgeable friend who can point you in the right direction.

🏥 **Please remember:**
• This analysis is based on patterns in medical data, not a clinical examination
• Every person is unique - your actual condition may differ
• Some serious conditions can have mild early symptoms
• When in doubt, it's always better to consult a healthcare professional
• For emergencies, call your local emergency number immediately

Your health is precious - don't hesitate to seek professional care! 💙

🏥 **Recommended General Medicines Near You:**
I've found some qualified specialists in your area. You can view their locations on the map below and choose the most convenient option for you.

text.name: Dr. Nayem Hasan
text.About: Dr. Nayem Hasan is a Medicine Specialist in Dhaka. His qualification is MBBS, PGT (Medicine), CMU (Ultra). He is working as a Medicine Specialist doctor at Tairunnessa Memorial Medical College & Hospital. He regularly provides treatment to his patients at Digital Care Hospital, Badda. Practicing hour of Dr. Nayem Hasan at Digital Care Hospital, Badda is 7pm to 9pm (Closed: Friday).

text.name: Prof. Dr. Sayed Zakir Hossain
text.address: Cha-72/1, Progoti Soroni, Uttar Badda, Dhaka - 1212
text.About: Prof. Dr. Sayed Zakir Hossain is a Medicine Specialist in Dhaka. His qualification is MBBS, FCPS (Medicine), BCS (Health), Gold Medelist. He is working as a Medicine Specialist doctor in Shaheed Suhrawardy Medical College & Hospital. He regularly provides treatment to his patients at Ibn Sina Diagnostic Center, Badda. Practicing hour of Prof. Dr. Sayed Zakir Hossain at Ibn Sina Diagnostic Center, Badda is 5pm to 8pm (Closed: Thursday & Friday).

text.name: Dr. Tabassum Samad
text.address: Plot # 81, Block # E, Bashundhara R/A, Dhaka
text.About: Dr. Tabassum Samad completed her MBBS from Mymensingh Medical College. Afterward, she obtained FCPS in Internal Medicine and Nephrology from Bangladesh College of Physicians and Surgeons (BCPS). She completed her training at BIRDEM, BSMMU and Dhaka Medical College Hospital. Dr. Tabassum served at BIRDEM General Hospital as a medicine specialist and nephrologist and managed diabetic patients with kidney problems and other medical conditions for more than 20 years. She is highly skilled in general and intervention nephrology with an interest in managing diabetic kidney disease (DKD), glomerulonephritis, acute kidney injury (AKI), urinary tract infection (UTI), peritoneal dialysis (CAPD) and kidney transplant patients. She has expertise in renal biopsy and a special interest in CAPD catheter insertion. She has been involved with kidney transplants with experience in post-transplant follow-up.

messages.text: Find doctors near me

💬 **Let's try a different approach.**

Instead of general terms, can you tell me about specific physical sensations? For example:
• Where does it hurt?
• How do you feel overall?
• What's bothering you most?
I have stomach pain

✅ **Understood!** So far you have: **stomach pain, abdominal pain, pain**.

🤔 **Quick check:** Are you also experiencing any of these related symptoms?
• difficulty breathing • chest pain • which is small sac of fluid that cushions joints

💬 You can say **'yes to [symptom]'**, **'no'**, or **'that's all'** if you've covered everything.
defficuilty breathing

👂 **I'm listening!**

Any other symptoms to add? Or say **'that's all'** when you're ready for my analysis.
that's all

🧠 **Analyzing your symptoms...**

I'm processing: stomach pain, abdominal pain, pain

Please wait a moment while I provide you with a comprehensive analysis...

🤔 **Preliminary Analysis** (Multiple Possibilities)
Your symptoms suggest **drug reaction** as a possibility, but other conditions should also be considered.

� **Understanding drug reaction:**
An adverse drug reaction (ADR) is an injury caused by taking medication. ADRs may occur following a single dose or prolonged administration of a drug or result from the combination of two or more drugs.

🛡️ **Immediate Care Recommendations:**
• stop irritation
• consult nearest hospital
• stop taking drug
• follow up

📋 **Your Next Steps:**
• **Urgency Level:** Low - Monitor and consult if symptoms persist
• **Specialist to see:** General Medicine
• **What to tell your doctor:** Mention your symptoms: stomach_pain, abdominal_pain, pain
• **Preparation:** Note symptom duration, severity (1-10 scale), and any triggers

⚠️ **Important Medical Notice:**
I'm an AI assistant designed to help you understand your symptoms better, but I'm not a replacement for professional medical care. Think of me as a knowledgeable friend who can point you in the right direction.

🏥 **Please remember:**

• Every person is unique - your actual condition may differ
• Some serious conditions can have mild early symptoms
• When in doubt, it's always better to consult a healthcare professional
• For emergencies, call your local emergency number immediately

Your health is precious - don't hesitate to seek professional care! 💙

Afterward, she obtained FCPS in Internal Medicine and Nephrology from Bangladesh College of Physicians and Surgeons (BCPS). 💬 You can say **'yes to [symptom]'**, **'no'**, or **'that's all'** if you've covered everything.

✅ **Understood!** So far you have: **fever, headache, pain**.

🤔 **Quick check:** Are you also experiencing any of these related symptoms?
• inflammation in bursa • difficulty breathing • calf tenderness

💬 You can say **'yes to [symptom]'**, **'no'**, or **'that's all'** if you've covered everything.
no

👍 **Understood!** 

Any other symptoms you'd like to mention? Or say **'that's all'** if you're ready for my analysis.
that's all

🧠 **Analyzing your symptoms...**

I'm processing: fever, headache, pain

Please wait a moment while I provide you with a comprehensive analysis...

🤔 **Preliminary Analysis** (Multiple Possibilities)
Your symptoms suggest **peripheral artery disease** as a possibility, but other conditions should also be considered.

� **Understanding peripheral artery disease:**
peripheral artery disease is a medical condition that requires proper medical evaluation and treatment. Symptoms, causes, and treatments can vary significantly between individuals. A healthcare professional can provide personalized guidance based on your specific situation.

🛡️ **Immediate Care Recommendations:**
• Consult a qualified healthcare professional for accurate diagnosis
• Follow all prescribed medications and treatment plans
• Maintain a healthy lifestyle with proper diet and exercise
• Monitor your symptoms and report any changes to your doctor
• Attend all scheduled follow-up appointments

📋 **Your Next Steps:**
• **Urgency Level:** Low - Monitor and consult if symptoms persist

He is working as a Medicine Specialist doctor in Dhaka National Medical College & Hospital. He regularly provides treatment to his patients at Ibn Sina Medical Imaging Center, Zigatola. He is an Assistant Professor of Gastroenterology at Kurmitola General Hospital, Dhaka. He regularly provides treatment to his patients at Medinova Medical Services, Malibagh. Practicing hour of Dr. Sukanta Das at Medinova Medical Services, Malibagh is 7pm to 9pm (Sunday & Tuesday).
